definition.title: What is a Tagline?
definition.content: A tagline is a short, memorable phrase that captures the essence of your brand, product, or message. The best taglines are under 10 words, focus on transformation rather than features, and use language your audience immediately understands.

landingContent.formula: [WHO you help] + [WHAT you do] + [HOW you're unique]
tips: Keep it short - the best taglines are under 10 words
Focus on transformation, not features - what changes for your client?
Avoid jargon - use language your ideal audience immediately understands
Make it memorable - use rhythm, alliteration, or unexpected phrasing

faq.question: What makes a good tagline?
faq.answer: A good tagline is short (under 10 words), memorable, and focuses on the transformation or benefit you provide rather than what you do.

faq.question: Which style should I choose?
faq.answer: Benefit-focused works for most uses. Use action-oriented for calls-to-action, questions to engage curiosity, and statements for authority positioning.

faq.question: How many options should I generate?
faq.answer: Generate at least 5 options. More choices help you find the perfect fit and may inspire variations you hadn't considered.

faq.question: Can I combine elements from different taglines?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Use the generated options as inspiration and mix elements to create your perfect tagline.
